intro: Epacris nivalis, commonly known as the snow epacris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in shaded forest environments. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale pink, bloom in spring and attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Epacris nivalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with the right conditions.
